annotation.TEXT: But, knowing how unreliable that is... yeah.
I basically just copy/pasted this GYRB Switch Palace from the ROM with my VLDC5 level, Switch Block City. But, just for hahas, I put in the VLDC8 Worst World BGM here.
BGM: VLDC8 - Worst World Map
There's a silver P-switch in this block right here, so make sure you grab it. (If you accidentally stomp it here, use the pipe back to the left to reset this room again.)
This message box here says the same thing, as do the other message boxes in the level. Also, I don't show it here, but if you go get Yoshi, he says something different.
Okay, now if you stand on the rope and kick the ice block to the right from there, it should be guaranteed to work.
Oh, noes. Vanilla music. Better do something about that.
Okay, now let's not screw this up this time. So, will this P-switch act as silver, or blue?
Bingo! ...Hmm... But there's that other Yoshi coin up there... How would I reach that? Well, we'll get to that later.
Gotta go faster! Hurry, hurry!
So, yeah. Remember that ceiling entrance? Yep, it got used again. So, since I've got this silver P-switch with me now, let's go up this pipe right here again.
Okay, now this is extremely important. If you enter this pipe without a silver P-switch, you will regret it.
Here's another pipe. Oh, and I'm not going to hit the multi-coin blocks more than a few times each, since I've had a few ZSNES crashes while hitting them.
Well, I'd love to find out, but I prematurely pressed that previous P-switch. But, not to worry, as this pipe I just came through can be used to go back and get another.
Yeah, so at this point, I decided to point out the blue Koopas' failures, and also try out something that didn't work in VLDC8. (Get powered up first, just in case.)
Sweet! It worked! If you tried that in VLDC8, it wouldn't work, and you'd be the one that got hurt.
Whew, just made it! So, yeah. That was that other Yoshi coin we saw from that earlier room. And if I wasn't fast enough there, munchers would've been blocked me from it.
This ceiling block is another multi-coin block, which you'll likely want to hit with an ice block. It's tricky to hit it rapidly without accidentally knocking the ice block away, though.
Now, this message here assumes that you slide-killed the enemies back there. If you didn't, well... plot hole!
Just showing that the other turn block there only held a coin.
Also, going through that pipe resets the room, which means you can get another mushroom easily here. Feel free to do so if you want.
Oh, also, I remembered the invisible block sprite for this switch palace corner this time (unlike in my Switch Block City ROM).
BGM: Zelda: Oracle of Seasons - Dancing Dragon Dungeon
Well, of course I'll include this song in my VLDCâ‘¨ level! Anyway, unfortunately, it's not possible to progress this way right now. If only I had a silver P-switch...
So, right at the start, there's a keyhole, to make it obvious that there's a second exit. Also, there's this pipe in the ceiling, so let's check that out.
--D'oh! ...Yes, there's a silver D'oh. So much better than those bronze D'ohs.
GAAAMMMEEE!!!
This message is the same as the one in the Yoshi coin bonus room earlier. However, now, you want to do this in order to progress with the level. Oh, and as for this pipe...
That's silly how the game sometimes decides that the weapon I'm holding hits an enemy I'm trying to stomp before my feet do.
Toss an ice block at that turn block to claim this mushroom that you can use to recover 5 HP... Oh, wait, that's another game. And next, let's check out this yellow pipe.
...Yep. I screwed with the speed of the music there.
Oh, that guy caught my block! How dare you!
Alright, enough dilly-dallying. Time to actually start the VLDC9 level, Ice Block Cavern!
Ah, look familiar? This is the place that I made that other video of, just to give you guys a glimpse of the moon. But, how do you reach it? I'll let you guys ponder that for now.
...My level for... Well, it says right there. Okay, let's start the game here!
And yes, I did ask if it was okay for me to use additional messages in my level this way, and no one objected.
Ah, if you return here after hitting midpoint (either to reset this puzzle, or because you died), the midpoint bar will be replaced with a power up block.
...Yeah, this is just a simple reset pipe. So, grab an ice block, and...
Bingo! There's the key! Oh, but... you can't actually do it this way. I put in an anti-cheating measure for that method, in the form of hidden note blocks.
Alright, let's continue on with the level now.
It's got the same multi-coin block and 14 loose coins, and of course, the switches, which provide some help during the level, but aren't truly vital, so I won't hit 'em.
Okay, now for the GYRB Switch Palace, with all of its GYRB-iness.
Yep, all those things can be slide-killed here too.
Ah, so here's some ice blocks, along with a message that you should read, dude!
Hello, and welcome to...
At least you won't be trapped in an unwinnable situation if you try that, though, since this pipe is right here.
Now, how would I reach that Yoshi coin? ...Maybe eat a hit from the munchers? ...Well, I could, but that's not the preferred method. Instead, let's try what this message says.
Okay, that was unfortunate, but that's okay, since there's another power up in this little room down here. Just be careful of the munchers.
Oh, BTW, Spike Tops don't magically die just by going off the top or bottom of the screen in the VLDC9 Base ROM. So, just toss an ice block at these guys or whatever.
...Same ol', same ol'. Well, there are a few additions...
...Well, I have no idea how that happened. I never pressed down to duck or anything. Anyway, stand to the right of the bone, and kick the ice block left.
Whoops. Not what I intended to do. That's okay. Also, don't be moving too fast when you kick an ice block here.
Okay, so there's three levels to choose from here. The one on the left is the actual VLDC9 level, Ice Block Cavern. The middle one has switches, and the right one is...
Alright, now more progress can be made! There's some coins down here, including a multi-coin block, which of course I'm not going to hit very much.
Ah, midpoint. Also, there's a silver--
Triple combo! (3 hits, 600 points)
Anyway, get a power up there, and then... whoops!
I added a left arrow sign and this message at the start. In addition, the side exit is enabled, of course. (Also, more vanilla music speed adjusting.)
So, let's forget about the key and move on for now. (BTW, if you can manage to get that Koopa below to catch an ice block, then you certainly can get the secret exit that way.)
Well, that certainly wasn't supposed to happen. Okay, let's use this pipe to reset the room and try it again.
Get a few coins and another power up that you don't actually need an ice block for here, if you want.
Well, I've got power ups. I could just tank hits from the munchers to get the job done, right?
BGM: Touhou 6 - Cirno's Theme - Beloved Tomboyish Daughter
Yep, kicked ice blocks cannot harm you. However, for some reason, you can spin jump bounce off of them. I don't have any puzzles in this level that rely on that, though.
Unfortunately, due to some sort of glitch with one of the patches in the Base ROM, blue Koopas will often fail to catch a kicked ice block.
BGM: DKC2 - In a Snow-Bound Land
And yep, I came right out of the ceiling there. That secondary entrance is accessed from a few different screen exits in this level. Anyway, let's move forward here.
So, let's see if I can slide-kill this ground-based saw here...
Push! Aha, it's still silver! Yep, that's fixed in this ROM. Okay, now hurry up here if you want to get a Yoshi coin.
Now, for this part... There's a blue Koopa down there, and a ? block to the left that I can't hit myself. Seems like I just have to get the Koopa to catch an ice block, right?
Aha, now I can get past these munchers! But, what lies beyond them besides Chuck Man Jones there? Find out next time! To be continued... Yo!
Ah, blue Koopas can still sometimes catch ice blocks. I wonder if it's a sprite slot issue, like with attempting to shell-kill Thwomps and Thwimps...
